title: Need Font Choice For Thesis
content:
Hello every one,

I am a student at the City College of New York and is doing my thesis now,  
My thesis is about signage system in a 3-d form/ structure.

and is in search of a nice serif font to go with the system.  
I am working on the sketch for the structure now.

but I am wondering if anyone has information on the fonts choice that's  
suitable for such project?  
nicely defined san serif fonts and maybe with some variations?

any reply is greatly appreciated. again,

thanks all,  
eric
author: eric chang

comments.content:
Some recognizable type used in signage/a good place to start:  
 [Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020110238/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/frutiger/)  
 [ClearviewHwy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020110238/http:/www.clearviewhwy.com/)  
 [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020110238/http:/www.aiga.org/content.cfm/the-mostly-true-story-of-helvetica-and-the-new-york-city-subway)  
 [FF Netto](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020110238/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_netto_ot/?utm_source=NewsletterAug19&utm_medium=web&utm_content=NettoOT&utm_term=em&utm_campaign=FontFontFontsmith)

[Here's a discussion on wayfinding fonts.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020110238/http:/typophile.com/node/38424)

Thanks dave , I love the FF netto, and frutiger but I had hard time to get the FF netto, I will search for alternatives,  
thanks again.
